definition: see 懲惡揚善|惩恶扬善[cheng2 e4 yang2 shan4]
to punish/to reprimand/to warn
to hate/to loathe/ashamed/to fear/to slander
evil/fierce/vicious/ugly/coarse/to harm
see 惡心|恶心[e3 xin1]
to advise/to urge/to try to persuade/to exhort/to console/to soothe
good (virtuous)/benevolent/well-disposed/good at sth/to improve or perfect
to encourage virtue and punish evil (idiom); fig. poetic justice/you get what's coming to you
to distinguish good and evil (idiom); to uphold virtue and condemn evil/to praise good and expose vice
to enlighten/to civilize/to indoctrinate/to train (an animal)
to uphold good and suppress evil (idiom)
parable/allegory/satire
to warn (against some course)/to admonish
(literary) to remonstrate with one's superior tactfully
to praise the virtue of sb or sth while concealing their faults
variant of 諷喻|讽喻[feng3 yu4]
to avoid evil
to strongly criticize
to make the world a better place
to uphold virtue and condemn evil (idiom)
to secure a position/to take an official appointment
variant of 規誡|规诫[gui1 jie4]
love to all creatures (idiom, from Mencius); universal benevolence
